articles.title: "Little Angels" Art Troupe gives guest performance
articles.content:
"Little Angels" Art Troupe gives guest performance
Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- The "Little Angels" Art Troupe of the World Peace Federation gave a guest performance at the Ponghwa Art Theatre on Tuesday.
   Invited to the performance were Chairman Kim Yong Sun and Vice-Chairman Song Ho Gyong of the Korean Asia-Pacific Peace Committee and officials of education, culture and art.
   Head Pak Po Hui and principal members of the art troupe saw the performance together with them.
   The performers put on the stage colorful pieces including folk-dances reflecting old customs of the Korean people and juvenile mind with national emotion and songs  about the fellow countrymen's desire for national reunification.
   After the performance, a floral basket in the name of the Korean Asia-Pacific peace committee was conveyed to the 
Performers and chairman kim yong sun mounted the stage and 
Congratulated them on their successful performance.

articles.title: G.S. Kim Jong Il inspects KPA unit no. 937
articles.content:
G.S. Kim Jong Il inspects KPA unit no. 937
 Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) - General Secretary  Kim Jong Il inspected KPA unit no. 937 on Monday.
   General Kim Jong Il climbed up to the forward command post and was briefed on the situation by the commander of the unit. And he, looking forward at the enemy's position within a hailing distance, learned about the enemy's situation.
   He expressed great satisfaction at the fact that the servicemen of the unit have turned the whole defence area into an impregnable fortress to cope with the enemy's escalating aggressive moves and fully prepared themselves to defeat the invaders at a stroke.
   He highly praised the exploits performed by the unit for the country and the people, saying the unit, which gained fame in the fatherland liberation war against the U.S.  aggressors, is still displaying an indomitable might at the frontline of the acute confrontation.
   He said: As the imperialists and reactionaries are trying to stifle our socialist country by military force, we should heighten revolutionary vigilance to the utmost and keep ourselves in full combat preparedness.
   He then outlined highly important tasks for increasing the unit's combat power and fortifying the whole defence area.
   He inspected the unit's outposts and learned how the servicemen were performing their duty. He said that invincible is the KPA armed with the spirit of devotedly defending the leader, the spirit of human bomb and the spirit of suicide attack.
   The Supreme Commander had a picture taken with servicemen in a trench on the height.
   He then dropped in at the headquarters of the unit to inspire servicemen and pose for a picture with them.
   After the inspection, he enjoyed an art performance given by dependents of military personnel of KPA combined unit no. 313.
   He highly appreciated the successful performance by the women,  who are living and struggling as wives of revolutionaries.

articles.title: G.S. Kim Jong Il inspects artillery company
articles.content:
G.S. Kim Jong Il inspects artillery company
   Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) - General Secretary  Kim Jong Il on May 4 inspected an artillery company under KPA unit no. 681 which set an example for the whole army in supply service.
   He looked round a goat farm, sideline fields, barracks, storehouses of food and sideline products and other supply bases and facilities.
   He said the whole army should manage the economic life as assiduously and methodically as the soldiers of the company who successfully introduced the revolutionary way of life of the anti-Japanese guerrilla army.
   He met with Pang Chol Song, chief sergeant of the company, who played a big role in improving supply service for the welfare of the company, and showed high appreciation for his deeds of merit.
   He said all the units of the People's Army are working hard to build better living conditions by giving full play to the revolutionary spirit of self-reliance, and that they are  distinguishing themselves in land management and the work for the nation's prosperity as well, adding that this is a noble spiritual world that can be seen only in the People's Army, the army of the party, the army of the leader and the army of the people.
   He put forward tasks which will serve as guidelines in effecting a revolutionary change in supply service for soldiers.
   He gave soldiers of the company a pair of binoculars and an automatic rifle as gifts and posed for a photograph with them.

articles.title: Reception on Polish National Day
articles.content:
Reception on Polish National Day
 Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- Charge d'affaires ad interim of the polish embassy here Mieczyslaw Dedo gave a reception at his embassy on may 5 to celebrate the National Day of Poland.
   Invited to the reception were Kim Chang Ryong, Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs, and officials concerned.
   Speeches were made there.

articles.title: Korea-Mexico friendship school
articles.content:
Korea-Mexico friendship school
 Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- A school here was named the Korea-Mexico Friendship Pyongyang Kaeson Senior Middle School on May 5 with due ceremony.
   Present there were chairman of the Korea-Mexico Friendship Association Ri Jin Su, who is also vice-chairman of the central committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea, and members of the association.
   Speeches were made at the ceremony.

articles.title: Implementation of five-point policy of great national unity called for
articles.content:
Implementation of five-point policy of great national unity called for 
  Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- The publication of General Kim Jong Il's historic letter "Let Us Reunify the Country Independently and Peacefully Through the Great Unity of the Entire Nation," an undying library of great national unity which has opened up bright prospects for national reunification, is a great fortune of the Korean people.
   Chairwoman Ryu Mi Yong of the central committee of the Chondoist Chongu Party made the remarks in her statement dated May 5 supporting the letter.
   She said:
   It is only too reasonable that the General said the principle of national independence is the very basis of the great unity of the entire nation. The homogeneous Korean people who love the country and nation more than anybody else and have a strong capacity for united action have failed to achieve reconciliation and unity because the South Korean ruling quarters do not stand true to the principle of national independence.
   With the successive rulers of South Korea pursuing the policy of dependence on outside forces the unity of the nation has not yet been achieved. Any one who truly wants inter-Korean reconciliation and national unity should take the road of national independence, not dependence on outsiders.
   The Chondoist Chongu Party will carry through the five-point policy of great national unity which developed President Kim Il Sung's idea of great national unity to meet the requirements of the present times, and greatly help achieve the great unity of the entire nation in reliance upon the full display of spirit of the singlehearted unity.
   She expressed the belief that all the religionists and people of other social strata of South Korea, including Chondoists, will actively join in a nationwide struggle for the full implementation of the five-point policy of the great unity of the entire nation.

articles.title: NDFSK calls for fighting for labour emancipation
articles.content:
NDFSK calls for fighting for labour emancipation
 Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- The director of the workers and peasants department of the central committee of the National Democratic Front of South Korea (NDFSK) made public a statement on April 30, a day before May Day,  Seoul-based radio Voice of National Salvation said.
   There was a change of power in South Korea but elementary freedom and rights  of the workers are being ruthlessly trampled underfoot, he said.
   He noted that the 10 million workers should turn out as one in a mass struggle for a life worthy of man, vital rights and labour emancipation.
   He went on to say: NDFSK appeals to the 10 million workers to fight out for true labour emancipation and building of a new independent, democratic society.

articles.title: Five-point policy of great national unity supported
articles.content:
Five-point policy of great national unity supported
 Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- Indian political and public figures supported "Let Us Reunify the Country Independently and Peacefully Through the Great Unity of the Entire Nation," a historic letter of General Kim Jong Il.
   Briz Mohan, Chairman of the Indian People's Front, in a press statement on April 24 said that General Kim Jong Il in his letter set forth the five-point policy of great national unity to reunify the country. The policy  serves as the only banner to accelerate the reunification of Korea, he stressed.
   He expressed the belief that all the Korean people will achieve the reunification of the country at an early date, encouraged by his letter.
   The co-chairman of the All-India Peace and Solidarity organisation in a press statement on April 27 warmly welcomed the letter, saying that it is the only just program which carries a constructive proposal to achieve the reunification of the country by the efforts of the Korean people themselves.
   The way for Korea's reunification which accords with the interest of the nation cannot be found only by negotiations between authorities, he said. Only when all the Koreans in the north, south and overseas are united under the banner of national reunification and make free and sincere discussions, can a reasonable and realistic way for reunification be found.
   He urged the South Korean authorities to affirmatively respond to the proposal for reunification through confederation and the five-point policy of great national unity.

articles.title: Ceaseless war manoeuvres in South Korea
articles.content:
Ceaseless war manoeuvres in South Korea
 Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- The South Korean army metropolitan defense command staged another criminal war exercise, according to a radio report from Seoul.
   The command announced that vehicles of all the units under it will take part in the exercise and pass through the central part of Seoul including Kwanak, Tongjak and Jongro districts on may 4 and 9.
   The puppets also declared that a mountain-crossing march will be made in Jongro and Unphyong districts.
   Such ceaseless war manoeuvres fully reveal the bellicose colors of the new "government" of South Korea.

articles.title: S. Korean rulers hit for brutal suppression of labour movement
articles.content:
S. Korean rulers hit for brutal suppression of labour movement
    Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the central committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea issued a statement to the press on May 5 denouncing the South Korean authorities for their fascist suppression of democratic labour movement.
   The statement describes the South Korean authorities' indiscriminate suppression of workers, who held a peaceful rally on may 1 calling for right to existence and freedom, and the arrest of scores of them as a brutal action aimed at emerging from the ongoing ruling crisis caused by political confusion and economic depression.
   The statement says:
   Their suppression of the righteous struggle of workers showed that the "labor-management-government agreement" on their lips is a sheer lie and that the South Korean rulers are clean indifferent to the life and interests of the workers and people of other social strata.
   The realities of South Korea clearly show that there is nothing for the South Korean workers and people of other social strata to expect from the present "government" any longer.
   Only slavish submission, toil and miserable death are in store for the workers and other laboring people in South Korea where the calls of the people for breaking with the past and making a policy shift are ignored and the former rulers'  fascist and anti-social policy of dependence on outsiders still remain unchanged.
   The South Korean workers should harbour no illusion about the present government, but win a new life through their united efforts.
   If the South Korean upper echelons in power do not want to meet a miserable end as their predecessors did, they should put an immediate halt to the fascist suppression of workers and other people and release the unreasonably arrested workers and students at once.
